Hymn.Arabic: 9- ثم انصرف من هناك و جاء الى مجمعهم.
Hymn.English: 9 Now when He had departed from there, He went into their synagogue.

Hymn.Arabic: 10- و اذا انسان يده يابسة فسالوه قائلين هل يحل الابراء في السبوت لكي يشتكوا عليه.
Hymn.English: 10 And behold, there was a man who had a withered hand. And they asked Him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?--that they might accuse Him.

Hymn.Arabic: 11- فقال لهم اي انسان منكم يكون له خروف واحد فان سقط هذا في السبت في حفرة افما يمسكه و يقيمه.
Hymn.English: 11 Then He said to them, What man is there among you who has one sheep, and if it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?

Hymn.Arabic: 12- فالانسان كم هو افضل من الخروف اذا يحل فعل الخير في السبوت.
Hymn.English: 12 Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep? Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath.

Hymn.Arabic: 13- ثم قال للانسان مد يدك فمدها فعادت صحيحة كالاخرى.
Hymn.English: 13 Then He said to the man, Stretch out your hand. And he stretched it out, and it was restored as whole as the other.

Hymn.Arabic: 14- فلما خرج الفريسيون تشاوروا عليه لكي يهلكوه.
Hymn.English: 14 Then the Pharisees went out and plotted against Him, how they might destroy Him.

Hymn.Arabic: 15- فعلم يسوع و انصرف من هناك و تبعته جموع كثيرة فشفاهم جميعا.
Hymn.English: 15 But when Jesus knew it, He withdrew from there. And great multitudes followed Him, and He healed them all.
16 Yet He warned them not to make Him known,

Hymn.Arabic: 17- لكي يتم ما قيل باشعياء النبي القائل.
Hymn.English: 17 that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Isaiah the prophet, saying:

Hymn.Arabic: 18- هوذا فتاي الذي اخترته حبيبي الذي سرت به نفسي اضع روحي عليه فيخبر الامم بالحق.
Hymn.English: 18 Behold! My Servant whom I have chosen, My Beloved in whom My soul is well pleased! I will put My Spirit upon Him, And He will declare justice to the Gentiles.

Hymn.Arabic: 19- لا يخاصم و لا يصيح و لا يسمع احد في الشوارع صوته.
Hymn.English: 19 He will not quarrel nor cry out, Nor will anyone hear His voice in the streets.

Hymn.Arabic: 20- قصبة مرضوضة لا يقصف و فتيلة مدخنة لا يطفئ حتى يخرج الحق الى النصرة.
Hymn.English: 20 A bruised reed He will not break, And smoking flax He will not quench, Till He sends forth justice to victory;

Hymn.Arabic: 21- و على اسمه يكون رجاء الامم.
Hymn.English: 21 And in His name Gentiles will trust.

Hymn.Arabic: 22- حينئذ احضر اليه مجنون اعمى و اخرس فشفاه حتى ان الاعمى الاخرس تكلم و ابصر.
Hymn.English: 22 Then one was brought to Him who was demon-possessed, blind and mute; and He healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

Hymn.Arabic: 23- فبهت كل الجموع و قالوا العل هذا هو ابن داود  "
Hymn.English: 23 And all the multitudes were amazed and said, Could this be the Son of David?.     Glory is due to our God to the age of all ages. Amen
